ISSUE.TITLE: Adding a shared theme folder
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: nopCommerce version: 4.30 Steps to reproduce the problem: N/A We recently created a second theme for our store, and we found that we had to copy and paste a lot of our custom views from one theme to the other, which is difficult to maintain. We want to avoid modifying the base nop /Presentation/Nop.Web/Views folder to make upgrades easier. We added a Shared folder to the /Presentation/Nop.Web/Themes folder for views that are used by all of our themes, and we modified Nop.Web.Framework.Themes.ThemeableViewLocationExpander to look in this Shared folder if the view was not found the the current theme's folder. This way any theme can override a shared view, but all themes have the shared view by default. I'll put together a pull request with our implementation.
